text: Brazil the biggest country in Latin
America has been hugely affected by the

system here is so close to collapse that
they have been converting football
stadiums into temporary hospitals inside
this one in Sao Paulo there are more
than 200 beds for patients with kovat 90
as for lockdowns
cities and local authorities have been
putting them in place themselves but the

against the idea of a national shut down
he says he's worried about the economic
impact of such measures Ecuador is at
the moment the Latin American country
hardest hit by the corona virus outbreak
thousand of people have died in the

System collapse more tourists and

embodied nightmare no one wants to see
replicated in other countries of the
region many economies in Latin America

weakest of them all it's been in a deep
economic crisis for years here while
there are not that many official deaths
the health care system is one of the
most stretched and badly prepared in

are trying to get ready for coffee 19
but doctors I spoke with say that there
are nowhere near enough intensive care

government has put in place a shutdown

Venezuela in many of these countries
most people live from the informal

every single day this treat in
Colombia's capital bubble done normally
is full of street vendors people who are
selling things from empanadas to

and these people have no source of
income where authorities say that the

way to avoid the health systems collapse
but not in all the part of Latin America
has it been closed here in Krag WA
people continue with daily life
the government has ignore messages from

government says the economic cause of
